oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sarcophagus of Roman Emperor
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This etching features the ornate sarcophagus of the Roman Emperor Severus Alexander (who reigned from 222 to 235 AD).

The sarcophagus of Roman Emperor Severus Alexander which Commodore J. D. Elliott, United States Navy had brought to America. Commodore Elliott offered this sarcophagus to Andrew Jackson as a coffin, but he graciously declined. This etching was provided through the courtesy of the Smithsonian Institution, Washington, D. C.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wall, Bernhardt, 1872-1956
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845; Elliott, Jesse D. (Jesse Duncan), 1782-1845; Severus Alexander, Emperor of Rome, 208-235
Sarcophagi; Coffins
